original_title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
text:
(1) Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between Coney Island Ave., and East 4th Street, showing the Brighton Beach Hotel, which was 460 feet long by 200 feet deep, 3 to 4-stories high, and at its four towers from 6 to 7-stories.

About 1901.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a view northeast.

About 1901.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, viewed south from the Brighton Beach subway station, elevated at this point.

March 31, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster collection.

(4) The same, showing the hotel demolished, with the Music Hall soon to follow.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
text:
(1) Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between Coney Island Ave., and East 4th Street, showing a northwest view of the Brighton Beach Music Hall, and a part of the Brighton Beach Hotel.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a view northeast.
December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, showing the Reigelmann Boardwalk, to the right of which is the site of the Brighton Beach Hotel.

November 25, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing another view of the hotel site and the Reigelmann Boardwalk.

November 25, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
text:
(1) Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between East 4th Street and Coney Island Ave., showing East 4th Street at the right, south to the Reigelman Board Walk.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a closer view of the demolition of the Brighton Beach Hotel.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same as view No. 1.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, looking southeastward.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
text:
(1) Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between East 4th Street and Coney Island Ave., showing the Brighton Beach Hotel, and the Brighton Beach Music Hall, at the right, under the process of demolition. In the foreground is a section of the Brighton Beach Line of the B.M.T.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing a closer view of the hotel.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, seen looking north from the beach.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, looking west.

July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
text:
(1) Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between East 4th Street and Coney Island Ave., showing a view, taken from the Culver Line platform, looking southeast, of the Brighton Beach Hotel being demolished. Standing alone but once connected with the hotel is the Brighton Beach Music Hall. July 15, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, demolished. November 25, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same. November 25, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing partially cleared site of the hotel and a view eastward. November 25, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
